summary: The document is a letter from Richard Helms, the Director of the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA), to Charles, dated 26 November 1968. It discusses the recommendation against the declassification of a Warren Commission document (CD-97) related to the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. The letter reveals internal considerations and the anticipation of public pressure for the release of Warren Commission papers, which did not materialize. Helms agrees with Charles's points for keeping the document out of the public domain and indicates no intention to release it at that time, highlighting the CIA's stance on maintaining secrecy around certain Warren Commission findings.
key_findings: The letter pertains to the declassification of Warren Commission documents related to the assassination of President John F. Kennedy.
Richard Helms, as CIA Director, was involved in decisions regarding the release of sensitive documents.
There was internal consideration and anticipation of public pressure for document release, which did not occur as expected.
The document highlights the CIA's stance on maintaining secrecy around certain Warren Commission findings.
